header.title: Plates - Exercises
authors: Esoteric School of Shamanism and Magic

central_thesis: The document operates under the implicit thesis that practical application, structured self-observation, and diligent record-keeping of specific magical and energetic exercises are fundamental to the development of occult skills and a deeper understanding of magical principles taught within the Esoteric School of Shamanism and Magic curriculum.

structure_content.summary: This section outlines the primary exercises for the current module (C19), including daily rituals (Exit Ritual, Day Greetings, Day Endings), a specific 'Plate' keying exercise, energetic 'line cutting' practices, healing techniques, and Tarot deck attunement. Students are instructed to perform these practices and meticulously record their observations and results.

Details the process for performing a 'Plate' keying exercise. Students are required to sense the energetic state of their 'Plate' before and after the keying process, recording any differences, unique experiences, questions, or comments in designated forms. This emphasizes direct energetic perception and comparative analysis.

Instructs students to perform 'line cutting' on themselves or others. They must record the name of the person, the specific 'form of cutting used' (e.g., scatter, snap back, brown energies, Lemniscate), and both immediate and long-term results. This points to specific energetic manipulation techniques with varying effects.

Encourages students to practice healing techniques learned in class, either when opportunities arise or on themselves. The exercise requires recording the 'Healing Technique Used,' the 'Condition Before Healing,' 'Condition Immediately After Healing,' and 'Condition After Several Days,' facilitating an assessment of efficacy over time.

Provides instructions for 'keying' a Tarot deck, as per class notes. The core task is to identify and record any cards that 'will not window,' implying a failure to energetically attune or connect with certain cards. Students are also to record any feedback received from their instructor regarding this process.

key_concepts.term: Exit Ritual, Day Greetings, Day Endings
key_concepts.definition: A set of daily magical or spiritual practices, implicitly designed to structure and energetically align the practitioner's daily life, marking transitions and setting intentions within a magical context.

A specific energetic or magical process to attune, activate, or imbue a 'Plate' (likely a magical tool, object, or energetic construct) with intent or energy, with the purpose of observing its energetic state before and after the operation.

A practical energetic manipulation technique applied to oneself or others. The diverse 'forms of cutting' (scatter, snap back, brown energies, Lemniscate) suggest different energetic actions, such as dispersal, redirection, grounding, or energetic flow patterns.

Practical methods taught within the Esoteric School of Shamanism and Magic curriculum aimed at addressing energetic or physical imbalances through magical or shamanic means, requiring systematic observation of conditions before, immediately after, and long-term.

Refers to a state of energetic attunement or connection with a Tarot card during a 'keying' process. A card that 'will not window' implies a lack of proper attunement, connection, or activation for that specific card within the practitioner's energetic system or the deck itself.

practical_system.description: The document outlines a practical system focused on hands-on application and empirical observation within a magical curriculum. It integrates daily foundational rituals with specific, advanced energetic manipulation techniques ('keying plates,' 'cutting lines'), healing modalities, and tool attunement (Tarot). The system is characterized by its rigorous requirement for students to perform operations, sense energetic changes, and meticulously record outcomes, effectively building a personal database of magical experiences and their effects. This fosters a highly experimental and results-oriented approach to magical development.
tools: Plate (implied magical object or energetic focus)
rituals: Cutting Lines (energetic manipulation in forms like scatter, snap back, brown energies, Lemniscate)
Keying Your Tarot Deck (energetic attunement of cards)

relevant_quotes.text: Do the Exit Ritual, Day Greetings and Day Endings.
Key your Plate. Record your results in the form provided below.
Feel your Plate before you start the keying process and record the results in Form 1 below.
Cut lines on yourself or another person this week and record any results in the form below.

Use any opportunities that present themselves this week to practice the healing techniques taught in this week's class. If you find no opportunities, do some healing work on yourself and record the results below.
Record any cards that will not window in the form below and tell the instructor. Also record any feedback from the instructor in the form below.

critical_analysis.relevance: These exercises are highly relevant as a practical backbone for students engaged in the 'Esoteric School of Shamanism and Magic.' They provide structured methods for applying theoretical magical principles, developing direct energetic perception, and honing operational skills. The emphasis on detailed record-keeping aligns with a scientific approach to magical practice, fostering self-correction and a deeper understanding of cause-and-effect within magical operations. This framework supports the experiential learning necessary for mastery in occult disciplines, reinforcing the idea that magical knowledge is built through direct experience and documented results.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience is students actively enrolled in or following the curriculum of the 'Esoteric School of Shamanism and Magic,' specifically at the C19 level. Practitioners seeking to develop foundational skills in energetic manipulation, ritual work, magical healing, and Tarot attunement through a structured, assignment-based approach would also find this relevant, assuming access to the accompanying class notes and instruction.
